business.headline: ICICI Bank hikes minimum savings balance to Rs 50,000: What it means for youThe change applies to all new accounts opened after that date, setting a new benchmark in the industry for the highest MAB requirement among domestic banks.

Ease of doing business: Piyush Goyal resolves Swiss firm's land issue in hoursUnion Minister Piyush Goyal resolved a complex land allocation issue for a major Swiss company during a live business conference, highlighting the ease of business in India.

Trump's tariff war: Is this India's 1991 moment? Montek Singh Ahluwalia exclusiveAt the Business Today India@100 Summit, Montek Singh Ahluwalia, former Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission, discusses if the 2025 Trump tariff war presents a 1991-like moment for India.

Piyush Goyal exclusive: Whole world recognises India as fastest-growing economyUnion Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the Indian economy and said the whole world recognises us as the fastest-growing large economy.

'A win for India': Piyush Goyal on clinching UK free trade dealUnion Minister Piyush Goyal, speaking at the Business Today India@100 Summit, called the India-UK free trade deal a big win for the country.

Cabinet approves Rs 30,000 crore subsidy to oil companies to keep LPG prices stableThe decision aims to protect consumers from changes in global LPG prices and support the financial health of the public sector oil companies.

Sensex cracks below 80,000 as tariff fears rattle stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 765.47 points to close below the psychological 80,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 232.85 points to settle at 24,363.30. Midcap and smallcap stocks witnessed deeper cuts, reflecting growing investor unease over the evolving global trade scenario.

India not a dead economy, poised to become 3rd-largest in world: Amitabh KantAfter Donald Trump's 'dead economy' jibe, Amitabh Kant calls India a resilient, reform-driven powerhouse on track to become the world's third-largest economy.

US tariff surge could stall India's manufacturing momentum, warns Moody'sOn Thursday, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order that adds a 25% tariff on Indian goods. This move comes in response to India's continued import of oil from Russia.

How much will India's fuel bill rise if it stops buying oil from Russia?Russia currently provides 10% of the world's crude supply. If multiple countries stop buying from Russia at once, crude oil prices could rise by around 10%, as per the report. That would affect everyone, not just India.
Gold hits record high of Rs 1.02 lakh. Is it the right time to buy?The rally in gold comes amid growing concerns over new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump.

Arvind Panagariya bets on these states to leads India's growth by 2047Arvind Panagariya explained that India doesn't need to push growth artificially. He believes market forces are already at work, shaping the country's growth naturally.

entertainment.headline: Sholay's 50th anniversary: 4K restoration to premiere at Toronto Film FestivalThe Film Heritage Foundation has restored the iconic film 'Sholay' in 4K to celebrate its 50th anniversary, with a special premiere set at the Toronto International Film Festival.

Sushmita Sen calls her mother a hero, her blessing, in special birthday postSushmita Sen celebrated her mother Subhra Sen's birthday with a heartfelt Instagram post, calling her a "rockstar" and her "hero."

Priyanka Chopra recalls how she earned Barfi role despite director's doubts. WatchPriyanka Chopra looked back on her journey of portraying Jhilmil in 'Barfi!', a role director Anurag Basu initially couldn't envision her in. She shared how intense workshops, deep research, and stepping out of her comfort zone helped her bring the character to life.

Priyanka Chopra to Ibrahim Ali Khan, Bollywood celebs share Raksha Bandhan 2025 wishesBollywood stars marked Raksha Bandhan 2025 with emotional posts, sharing pictures and heartfelt messages for their siblings. Celebrities like Ibrahim Ali Khan, Priyanka Chopra, Parineeti Chopra, Ananya Panday, Karan Johar, and Kangana Ranaut expressed love and warm wishes on social media.

Was sobbing with gratitude: Sonu Nigam after Sidharth-Janhvi's Pardesiya releaseSonu Nigam was deeply moved by the overwhelming love for his latest song 'Pardesiya' from the film 'Param Sundari'. The film, starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, is eagerly awaited with its new release date set for August 29, 2025.

Namrata Shirodkar makes memories with Priyanka Chopra, Malti Marie in HyderabadNamrata Shirodkar shared a sweet moment with Priyanka Chopra Jonas, posting a picture on social media. Priyanka is currently in Hyderabad with daughter Malti Marie for the shoot of 'SSMB 29'.

I'll never make films to sway people: John Abraham on his creative stand with TehranActor John Abraham discussed the challenges of censorship in Indian cinema, emphasising the delicate balance between creative freedom and regulatory oversight. He shared his journey with the film 'Tehran', highlighting the political sensitivities filmmakers face.

Milind Soman's 86-year-old mother nails skipping, fans call it incredibleMilind Soman shared a video of his 86-year-old mother Usha skipping rope with him and wife Ankita Konwar, leaving fans amazed. People called her "truly incredible" and praised her for staying active with daily skipping and yoga.

Raksha Bandhan 2025: Riddhima Kapoor to Sanjay Dutt, celebs extend wishesOn Raksha Bandhan 2025, celebrities from across the film and TV industry celebrated the festival by sharing heartfelt wishes and photos with their siblings on social media.

Mahesh Babu turns 50: Jr NTR, Chiranjeevi, celebs wish actor on milestone birthdayMahesh Babu celebrated his 50th birthday on August 9, with fans and celebrities flooding social media with love and wishes. Actors like Jr NTR, Chiranjeevi, and Gopichandh Malineni praised the Tollywood icon for his talent, humility, and inspiring journey.

SSMB29: Rajamouli shares Mahesh Babu's 1st look, full glimpse to release in NovemberAn official update on Mahesh Babu and SS Rajamouli's 'SSMB29' is out. On Babu's 50th birthday, the makers shared the first glimpse from the highly-awaited Telugu film.

Across genres, through hearts: How British films, shows are finding their momentBritish content has gone from niche to global hit - thanks to its sharp writing, dry humour, and deeply relatable themes. From binge-worthy dramas to clever comedies, the content is striking a chord with viewers globally.

Sidharth Malhotra, Janhvi Kapoor dazzle in ivory-gold at Gaurav Gupta's bridal debutSidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor mesmerised at Gaurav Gupta's bridal couture launch on Friday. The duo stunned as showstoppers in regal ivory and gold ensembles.

Sholay@50: RD Burman's Beer Bottles and Whistles Crafted an Iconic ScoreBlending Indian and Western musical elements with ease, RD Burman experimented with unconventional instruments like coconut shells and beer bottles. The result wasn't just a film score. It was music that helped turn Sholay into a cinematic legend.

Vivek Agnihotri reacts to Anurag Kashyap's liar remark: 2-3 people live inside himFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has responded to Anurag Kashyap's allegations, addressing their long-standing professional differences with a mix of criticism and respect. He also backed his past claims about the latter's ''drinking habits''.

Hrithik Roshan's pool workout video has fans gushing over his sculpted bodyHrithik Roshan has shared a behind-the-scenes glimpse of his disciplined training regime for his upcoming film 'War 2'. The unfiltered video has got fans gushing over his chiselled body.

Swara Bhasker slams troll over casteist, classist jibe at husband Fahad AhmadActor Swara Bhasker strongly reacted to a troll for his derogatory remarks about her husband Fahad Ahmad. She emphasised the classist nature of the slur in her response.

Sooraj Barjatya on Salman Khan's return as Prem: Script must be age-appropriateDirector Sooraj Barjatya hinted at actor Salman Khan's return as Prem in Rajshri Productions' future project. He opened up on working on an age-appropriate script for Salman.

Udaipur Files released after long legal battle, audience call it mirror to societyUdaipur Files has been released nationwide after legal hurdles. The film highlights societal silence and calls for justice in the Kanhaiyalal murder case.

general news.headline: Summit holds promise of ending Ukraine war: India on Trump-Putin Alaska meetDonald Trump announced on Truth Social that the "highly anticipated meeting" with Russian President Vladimir Putin will be held next Friday in the "Great State of Alaska", with further details to be revealed later. India, welcoming the development, expressed hope that the summit would pave the way for an end to the conflict in Ukraine.

Took care of ghost of Balakot: Air Force chief on evidence of Op Sindoor successAir Chief Marshal AP Singh laid out evidence of the damage India inflicted on Pakistan during Operation Sindoor. Calling it the moment that "took care of the ghost of Balakot," the Air Force chief said intelligence this time left no room for doubt.

17 injured as slab collapses at Nagpur temple construction siteThe incident took place during work being carried out under the Nagpur Metropolitan Region Development Authority (NMRDA) for the Koradi temple. A few workers were initially feared trapped, but no casualties have been reported so far.

Asaduddin Owaisi calls Pahalgam attack painful, vows to boycott India-Pak matchCalling cricket in India "an obsession" that brings everything to a standstill, he said that it makes no sense to play a cricket match when so many stringent measures have been taken against Pakistan.

A heavy Brics blowback brewing for Trump?Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Brazilian counterpart Lula da Silva called up PM Narendra Modi. The Indian PM is set to visit China soon for the SCO summit. Brics activity has gained momentum amid Trump's tariffs, attacks on the bloc and his cryptocurrency bet against the reported Brics currency.

Trump Tariff Tantrum: Hold steady all you strategically autonomous folksDonald Trump's steep tariffs and hostile rhetoric have strained US-India ties, which have prompted Delhi to signal strategic rebalancing while refusing to compromise on its red lines.

No aircraft hit: Pak after India says it downed 6 jets during Op SindoorPakistan asserted that none of its aircraft were hit or destroyed during Operation Sindoor, just hours after Indian Air Force chief, Air Chief Marshal AP Singh, said Indian forces downed six Pakistani jets.

Maharashtra's Islampur to become 'Ishwarpur'? Decoding Mahayuti's renaming politicsThe Mahayuti also plans to rename Chhatri Nizampur. The latest round of changes in Islamic-sounding names of cities is seen by critics as an attempt to blur Muslim identity

Nasa's SpaceX Crew-10 splashes down in Pacific after 5-month stay on Space StationCrew-10 was originally slated to leave the orbiting laboratory on Thursday. However, the departure was postponed due to inclement weather at the landing site. The journey from the ISS to the California coast aboard the gumdrop-shaped Dragon capsule took 17.5 hours.

Putin, Brazil President discuss Ukraine peace ahead of US-Russia meet in AlaskaPutin discussed BRICS cooperation and recent peace efforts between Russia and Ukraine with Brazil's Lula after speaking with Modi, ahead of his meeting with Trump in Alaska.

At 26.4°C, Delhi logs coolest August day in 34 yearsDelhi recorded a maximum temperature of 26.4 degrees Celsius on Saturday. The all-time lowest for August was 25.3 degrees Celsius, recorded on August 9, 1976.

Nadal becomes father again, welcomes baby boy Miquel with wife MariaRafael Nadal and his wife Maria Francisca Perello became parents on August 7 and named their baby boy, Miquel. They became parents for the first time in 2022 after marrying in 2019.

Sholay@50: RD Burman's Beer Bottles and Whistles Crafted an Iconic ScoreBlending Indian and Western musical elements with ease, RD Burman experimented with unconventional instruments like coconut shells and beer bottles. The result wasn't just a film score. It was music that helped turn Sholay into a cinematic legend.

Watch: Elephant smashes car window with trunk at Uttarakhand toll plazaAn elephant on Saturday evening suddenly appeared at the Lachhiwala Toll Plaza on the Dehradun–Haridwar National Highway, causing chaos at the spot.

The elephant first approached the toll plaza station and knocked down the barrier at the VIP lane. Meanwhile, a car tried to force its way past in front of the elephant, which angered it. The elephant struck the car with its trunk, shattering the rear windshield.

Following that, the elephant apparently turned towards the white tempo but, luckily for the driver, made no contact. It then headed straight into the forest.

The sudden attack left all four passengers in the car terrified. Fortunately, the elephant did not launch any further attack and calmly returned to the forest.

Civil judge aspirant disappears during train journey in Madhya PradeshWhen 28-year-old Archana Tiwari did not get down at Katni station, her family began searching for her. Her bag was later found at the next station, Umaria, but there has been no trace of her since.

RG Kar protesters lathicharged, victim's mother says 'Mamata's cops' assaulted herThe unrest unfolded when the rally moved away from the designated protest site and diverted towards Park Street, where protesters tried to breach police barricades while marching towards the West Bengal secretariat, Nabanna.

Used cooking oil to power jet engines, so fry hardIndian Oil's Panipat refinery has been crowned the country's first to pump out sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) from used cooking oil. Your pakoda oil may now get a second life as rocket juice for a 747.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Flight ops hit at Mumbai airport due to network outage, Air India issues advisoryWhile the affected systems have now been restored, the airline said that residual delays may continue as operations gradually return to normal.

Could Alaska see yet another major Russia-US real estate deal?Donald Trump will meet Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15 – a historic summit with symbolic timing and potential implications for ending the Russia-Ukraine war.

Bangladesh and Myanmar polls will test India's alliances, borders and connectivity plansIndia faces uncertainty as Bangladesh and Myanmar prepare for contentious elections, with doubts over stability, participatory polls, and implications for Delhi's security and regional connectivity projects.

6.4 magnitude earthquake hits Russia days after massive 8.8 temblorA powerful 6.4-magnitude earthquake struck Russia's Kuril Islands, located in the northern Pacific Ocean near the Kamchatka Peninsula, which was the epicentre of the 8.8-magnitude earthquake last month, the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre said on Saturday.

Uddhav Thackeray's last-row seat at Rahul Gandhi dinner meet gets BJP tauntLeading the charge, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said when the undivided Shiv Sena was part of the NDA, Uddhav always sat in the first row.

sports.headline: Akash Deep reveals priceless advice from Virat Kohli, MS DhoniIndia fast bowler Akash Deep, who took 13 wickets on the England tour—including a six-wicket haul—shared the valuable advice he received from MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli.

Chennai Grand Masters: Keymer remains unbeaten, Erigaisi holds secondVincent Keymer stays perfect at Chennai Grand Masters, while Arjun Erigaisi climbs to second after defeating Ray Robson in Round 3.

Gill, Bumrah draw big bucks, Test jerseys auctioned for Rs 5 lakhShubman Gill and Jasprit Bumrah fetched the big bucks as their jerseys were auctioned off for a hefty amount as part of the Ruth Strauss Foundation's charitable cause.

Nadal becomes father again, welcomes baby boy Miquel with wife MariaRafael Nadal and his wife Maria Francisca Perello became parents on August 7 and named their baby boy, Miquel. They became parents for the first time in 2022 after marrying in 2019.

Australia vs South Africa T20I series: Squads, all you need to knowAUS vs SA: Mitchell Marsh's Australia and Aiden Markram's South Africa will be up against each other in a three-match T20I series to be held from August 10 to 16 in Darwin and Cairns.

Samson, Ashwin in awe of Suryavanshi: Quality of his shots shocked meBoth Sanju Samson and R Ashwin were left in awe of the talent that is Vaibhav Suryavanshi. The former RR teammates reflected on how the young star impressed in his first IPL season.

Andy Roddick backs Naomi Osaka after backlash over Mboko controversyAndy Roddick defended Naomi Osaka after criticism of her brief runner-up speech following a 6-4, 4-6, 1-6 loss to Victoria Mboko in the 2025 Montreal Open final. He argued that expecting players to deliver polished remarks immediately after a tough defeat is unrealistic.

Srikkanth on Ashwin's rumoured exit: CSK want to win championshipsFormer India cricketer Krishnamachari Srikkanth says Ravichandran Ashwin's possible CSK exit could aid the team's rebuild, urging focus on youth and results in the quest for future IPL titles.

Shaheen Afridi joins Wasim Akram in elite club with 4-wicket haul in 1st ODIPAK vs WI: Shaheen Shah Afridi helped Pakistan defeat West Indies by five wickets in the first ODI after taking four wickets at the Brian Lara Stadium in Tarouba, Trinidad.

David de Gea given fitting tribute on Old Trafford return: WatchDavid de Gea returns to Old Trafford with Fiorentina, receiving a tribute as Manchester United honour his decorated career at the club. The former goalkeeper was the last remaining member of Sir Alex Ferguson's final squad, and he left after his contract expired in 2023.

New Zealand claim series against Zimbabwe with their biggest Test winMitchell Santner's New Zealand won their Test series 2-0 against Zimbabwe after winning the second game in Bulawayo by an innings and 359 runs. The Kiwis also racked up the third-biggest win ever in Test history.

He argued that expecting players to deliver polished remarks immediately after a tough defeat is unrealistic.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
